newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Toyota to reveal small car concept in September.
newsitem.headline: Toyota to reveal small car concept in September.

text.p: Japan's Toyota Motor Corp said on Wednesday it would unveil a new concept of cars with smaller engines at the September Frankfurt motor show, and it was considering making them at a new plant in Europe.

"At the moment, we are developing small cars which could be attractive and we hope to present a concept of them in a motor show to be held in Frankfurt in September," Toyota's president Hiroshi Okuda told Japanese reporters.
"Toyota is considering producing such new cars in Europe as it is important to strengthen our presence in Europe," he added.
Jiji News service reported on Wednesday that Toyota would jointly develop a one-litre car with Daihatsu Motor Co Ltd to sell worldwide after a launch in Japan in 1999.

Tatsuo Takahashi, president of Toyota Motor Europe Marketing & Engineering, said it had not been decided yet when production would start or whether it would launch the new small cars in Japan before starting to sell them in Europe.
Okuda is in Europe to meet reporters from European newspapers as well as Toyota's executives in Europe before flying to South Africa.
